result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan W. Mattonen

defendant.name: Mattonen, Jordan W.
defendant.address: 43320 N Lynn Dale Dr, Zion, IL 60099

records.addlTxt: 10:20 AM Defendant Jordan W. Mattonen in court.  Attorney Kristyne Watson in court for Jordan W. Mattonen.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.    On state's motion, this case is DRI.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Watson.   Clerk HMcBride.  Atty Watson requests adjmt to speak with the state. Granted. FPT 10/27 10am.  Bond continued.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.  This case has now been assigned to Judge Dougvillo.  Date and time remained the same.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Watson.   Clerk. M.Burke. STC set to 09/12/22 at 3:00.

State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Attorney Kristyne Watson in court with Defendant Jordan W. Mattonen who appears in custody.  Clerk: PT
   Preliminary hearing held in 22CF693 and bond continues on this file.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Watson.   Clerk. M.Burke. Atty Watson advises there is a new case. Case to trail 22CF693 to JPTC on 06/03/22 at 8:15 in intake.

Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson. Clerk/H. Barnett. Atty Watson states she needs time to discuss a global resolution w/deft and allow time for the new case to catch up. PTC continued to 5/31/22 at 3pm. Bond continued.

Defendant, Jordan W. Mattonen, appeared with Attorney Joseph Corcoran (for Atty Watson today).  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 2.  Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Branch 2 Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed by Atty. Kristyne Watson  kmk
